required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intrastromal Corneal Ring Segments and Toric Phakic Posterior Intra-ocular Lenses Implantation in Keratoconus
clinical_study.official_title: "Comparison Between Intrastromal Corneal Ring Segments and Toric Phakic Posterior Intra-ocular Lenses Implantation in Keratoconus"

brief_summary.textblock: To compare visual and refractive measurements of intrastromal corneal ring segments versus toric phakic posterior intra-ocular lenses implantation in keratoconus

detailed_description.textblock:
- The study is a prospective comparative interventional case series. It will be conducted in Minia university hospital and Roaa Laser Vision Correction Center.
- Fourty eyes will be evenly allocated into two groups:
Group (A): 20 eyes will undergo corneal collagen cross linking (epithelium off) 1 month after Femtosecond laser assisted intrastromal corneal keraring segments.
Group (B): 20 eyes will undergo toric phakic posterior IOL implantation 1 year after corneal collagen cross linking (epithelium off).
• An informed written consent to be involved in the study will be obtained from each patient.

primary_outcome.description: a device that read topometric corneal data and other data

arm_group.arm_group_label: corneal collagen cross linking and intrastromal corneal keraring segments.
arm_group.description: 20 eyes will undergo corneal collagen cross linking (epithelium off) 1 month after Femtosecond laser assisted intrastromal corneal keraring segments

arm_group.arm_group_label: toric phakic posterior IOL implantation and corneal collagen cross linking
arm_group.description: 20 eyes will undergo toric phakic posterior IOL implantation 1 year after corneal collagen cross linking (epithelium off).

intervention.description: ring hard segments inserted within corneal stroma using femtolaser
intervention.arm_group_label: corneal collagen cross linking and intrastromal corneal keraring segments.
toric phakic posterior IOL implantation and corneal collagen cross linking
intervention.other_name: toric phakic posterior IOL implantation/ corneal collagen cross linking

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Keratoconus grade I to III according to the Amsler-Krumeich classification
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute hydrops or grade IV keratoconus
- Any ocular diseases or surgeries
- Corneal thickness less than 400 µm at the thinnest corneal point, and at least 450 µm at the incision site for ICRS group
- Corneal pacities
